incidents.description: Two or more vehicles, or vehicle and object/pedestrian, collide; includes rear-end, sideswipe, etc.
incidents.examples: Crashed vehicles, deployed airbags, debris scattered; sudden stop on video; vehicles at odd angles
incidents.question_text: Do you see a collision in this video stream?

incidents.description: Any vehicle stopped in a lane (not at intersection or for traffic control); can be breakdown or crash
incidents.examples: Car stopped in travel lane with hazard lights, bus stopped out of bus stop, truck blocking lane
incidents.question_text: Do you see a stationary vehicle in this video stream?

incidents.description: Anything that blocks or significantly impedes one or more travel lanes
incidents.examples: Large debris, stalled vehicles, roadwork equipment left on road
incidents.question_text: Do you see an impediment blocking traffic in this video stream?

incidents.description: Incident involving a vulnerable road user (pedestrian, cyclist, motorcyclist); at risk of injury
incidents.examples: Pedestrian in crosswalk struck by car, cyclist falls, motorcycle rear-ended
incidents.question_text: Do you see a vulnerable road user incident (pedestrian, cyclist, motorcyclist) in this video stream?

incidents.description: Presence of chemical spill, leaking fluids, or hazardous objects requiring special response
incidents.examples: Liquid pooling on roadway from tanker crash, chemical barrels, visible spill warning signage
incidents.question_text: Do you see hazardous materials or spills in this video stream?

incidents.description: Non-hazardous debris that can cause a crash or impede flow; not roadwork/cones
incidents.examples: Tire fragments, furniture, tree branches, boxes on road
incidents.question_text: Do you see debris on the roadway in this video stream?

incidents.description: Incident confirmed or highly likely to involve a fatality (usually inferred from scene severity)
incidents.examples: Covered body, significant vehicle damage, emergency response with coroner, tarps
incidents.question_text: Do you see indicators of a fatal incident in this video stream?

incidents.description: Vehicle leaves roadway, enters shoulder, ditch, or hits barrier/embankment
incidents.examples: Vehicle veering off pavement, car found in ditch, tire tracks off-road
incidents.question_text: Do you see a vehicle departing from the roadway in this video stream?

incidents.description: A visible, sustained line of slow/stopped vehicles, not normal congestion
incidents.examples: Long backup from crash site, stopped cars beyond typical rush hour
incidents.question_text: Do you see a queue of stopped/slow vehicles in this video stream?

incidents.description: Abnormal, sustained reduction in speed/flow; may not have clear blockage
incidents.examples: Heavy, slow-moving traffic upstream of incident, gridlock
incidents.question_text: Do you see traffic congestion in this video stream?

incidents.description: One or more vehicles stop abruptly in short distance (may be near-miss indicator)
incidents.examples: Brake lights suddenly on, following vehicles close behind, tire smoke
incidents.question_text: Do you see harsh braking by vehicles in this video stream?

incidents.description: Sudden or erratic lateral movement by vehicle(s)
incidents.examples: Car quickly changing lanes to avoid debris, over-correction after drift
incidents.question_text: Do you see vehicles swerving in this video stream?

incidents.description: Incident classified by length of time it impacts roadway (minor <30min, intermediate, major >2hr)
incidents.examples: Persistent queue/congestion, stalled vehicle present for extended period
incidents.question_text: Does this incident appear to have lasted an extended period based on the video?

incidents.description: Commercial Motor Vehicle (truck, bus, etc.) is involved in or causes the incident
incidents.examples: Semi-truck in crash, bus blocking intersection, delivery truck with hazards
incidents.question_text: Do you see a commercial vehicle involved in this incident in the video stream?

incidents.description: Vehicle traveling substantially above posted or typical speed limit
incidents.examples: Car overtaking others at high speed, rapid acceleration through intersection
incidents.question_text: Do you see vehicles traveling at excessive speeds in this video stream?

actors.description: Typical personal vehicles: sedans, hatchbacks, coupes, small SUVs. Basis class for most scenes.
actors.examples: Sedan/SUV traveling in lane; parked shoulder vehicle; compact car in queue.
actors.question_text: Do you see passenger vehicles (cars, SUVs) in this video stream?

actors.description: Medium/heavy-duty vehicles used for commerce: delivery vans, box trucks, semi tractors, with/without trailer.
actors.examples: 18-wheeler in right lane; box truck double-parked; step-van at curb.
actors.question_text: Do you see commercial vehicles (trucks, delivery vans) in this video stream?

actors.description: Police, fire, ambulance; identifiable by livery, light bars, reflective striping; lights may be active.
actors.examples: Ambulance with flashing lights; fire engine across lanes; police SUV on shoulder.
actors.question_text: Do you see emergency vehicles (police, fire, ambulance) in this video stream?

actors.description: Two/three-wheeled motorized vehicles; rider posture and wheelbase profile distinguishable from bicycles.
actors.examples: Sport bike splitting lanes; cruiser at intersection; scooter in traffic.
actors.question_text: Do you see motorcycles in this video stream?

actors.description: Person on foot in or adjacent to roadway (sidewalk, shoulder, median, crosswalk).
actors.examples: Pedestrian in crosswalk; person stepping off curb; worker walking in lane.
actors.question_text: Do you see pedestrians in this video stream?

actors.description: Non-vehicle objects large enough to create a hazard or impede traffic.
actors.examples: Ladder/furniture in lane; fallen tree branch; pallet/box debris.
actors.question_text: Do you see debris on the roadway in this video stream?

actors.description: Containers/placards or visible liquid/particulate suggesting hazardous materials; may indicate elevated response.
actors.examples: Tanker with HAZMAT placard; visible leaking fluid pooling; drum with warning labels.
actors.question_text: Do you see hazardous materials indicators in this video stream?

actors.description: Vehicle apparently inoperable or broken down (often partially/fully impeding).
actors.examples: Car with hood up/hazards blinking; triangle/cone behind vehicle; driver standing by on shoulder.
actors.question_text: Do you see disabled vehicles in this video stream?

actors.description: Transit, school, or coach buses with distinctive length/door/window patterns and liveries.
actors.examples: City bus at stop blocking a lane; school bus with stop arm; coach bus at terminal.
actors.question_text: Do you see buses in this video stream?

actors.description: Pedal or e-bikes operated in roadway/shoulder/bike lane; rider + frame silhouette.
actors.examples: Cyclist in bike lane; e-bike entering crosswalk; group ride near curb.
actors.question_text: Do you see bicycles or cyclists in this video stream?

actors.description: Towed units (utility, flatbed, boat, box) attached to or separated from a tractor/vehicle.
actors.examples: Pickup with utility trailer; detached flatbed in lane; boat trailer backing.
actors.question_text: Do you see trailers in this video stream?

actors.description: Whole tires or tread gators separated from vehicles.
actors.examples: Large tread strip in middle lane; loose tire rolling toward shoulder.
actors.question_text: Do you see loose tires or tire debris in this video stream?

actors.description: Traffic cones, drums, delineators, barricades used to shape or restrict flow.
actors.examples: Cone line closing a lane; barrel cluster at taper; Type III barricade across ramp.
actors.question_text: Do you see traffic cones, barrels, or other traffic control devices in this video stream?

actors.description: Construction/maintenance vehicles not typical traffic: bulldozer, backhoe, grader, roller, excavator.
actors.examples: Excavator swinging over shoulder; road roller in work zone; loader crossing.
actors.question_text: Do you see heavy construction equipment in this video stream?

actors.description: Low-confidence/occluded/ambiguous object or actor that cannot be reliably classified.
actors.examples: Indistinct object under low light; partially occluded silhouette.
actors.question_text: Do you see unidentifiable objects or actors in this video stream?
